item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Free of Charge Medical Cannabis Clinic in Toronto and Across Ontario White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors offers specialized healthcare services to patients for whom medical cannabis--also known as medical marijuana--may be an appropriate treatment option. Our fully integrated clinics in Toronto, North York, Brantford, Kingston and across Ontario, offer comprehensive medical cannabis assessment and education services for eligible patients.  Patients in Canada can now get safe and legal access to cannabis oil, capsules and dried cannabis product through a doctor’s authorization under the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations (ACMPR).   All physician assessments are covered by OHIP and are free of charge to the patient. If you believe cannabis may be right for you, please connect with us by having your physician complete our referral package. If your physician is unable to complete our referral package, please contact our Intake department to request accommodation. Please note we are not a marijuana dispensary. Referral A Healthcare Practitioner must complete our Referral Form and submit all required supporting documentation. Patients unable to obtain a referral should contact us directly. Once all documentation has been received, patients will be contacted by our intake team for pre-assessment and appointment booking. REQUEST A REFERRAL PACKAGE Assessment Patients are assessed by qualified physicians in order to determine if medical cannabis is an appropriate treatment option for their medical condition and symptoms. Education All patients who are issued medical documents by the assessing physician will receive complimentary access to specialized cannabis education services offered by GrowWise Health, a medical cannabis education service. GrowWise Health Patient Educators provide patients with expert guidance on all matters related to their medical cannabis treatment in order to achieve optimal therapeutic effects and improve their quality of life. Click here for more information about GrowWise Health Patient Education  services and the GrowWise Health education blog can be found here.   Documentation Referring physicians will be provided with a detailed Consultation Note and follow-up Progress Notes, per CPSO recommendations. Referring physicians will also receive a comprehensive education service summary from GrowWise Health.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Free of Charge Medical Marijuana Clinic in Toronto & Across Ontario | White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors
Free medical marijuana clinic in Toronto for patients for whom medical cannabis may be an appropriate treatment option under the Marihuana for MMPR.

item.title: For Patients
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
ACMPR Medical Cannabis Access for Patients Free of Charge Medical Cannabis Clinics in Toronto and Across Ontario White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors has partnered with GrowWise Health to provide patients with access to the highest quality of care and cannabis education. All physician assessments are covered by OHIP and are free of charge to the patient. GrowWise Health patient education services are provided to patients on a complimentary basis.  Under the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulation (ACMPR), patients have access to the highest quality medical cannabis to help manage their symptoms and improve their quality of life. Research shows that medical cannabis has the potential to manage a variety of conditions and symptoms such as:
  • Chronic Pain
  • Fibromyalgia
  • Headaches and Migraines
  • Cancer
  • Nausea and Vomiting
  • Irritable Bowel Syndrome
  • Epilepsy
  • Multiple Sclerosis 
  • Crohn’s Disease
  • Post Traumatic Stress Disorder
  • Sleep
  • Arthritis
  • Palliative Care
All patients who are authorized to use cannabis for medical purposes will have the opportunity to receive free education services from GrowWise Health. The GrowWise Health Patient Educator will educate you on all matters related to your cannabis treatment and provide you with the tools needed to safely and effectively administer your medication. The GrowWise Health Patient Educator will facilitate fast and reliable access to your medication. All patients enrolled in the GrowWise Health Patient Education Program will have access to ongoing care, free of charge. To find out more, please visit the GrowWise Health website or Connect with a GrowWise Patient Educator. For more information on some of the conditions for which medical marijuana may be appropriate, please visit the GrowWise Health Benefits of Medical Cannabis page or read more on their Education Blog. If you believe cannabis may be right for you, please connect with us by having your physician complete our referral package. If your physician is unable to complete our referral package, please contact our Intake department to request accommodation.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Cannabis Clinics for Toronto Patients | White Cedar
White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors offers free of charge services for qualified patients in the Greater Toronto Area and across Ontario under the (MMPR).

item.title: For Healthcare Providers
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Medical Cannabis Referrals for Physicians Trusted by Healthcare Providers in the Greater Toronto Area and Across Ontario White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors is trusted by healthcare practitioners in the Greater Toronto Area and across Ontario. Research indicates that medical cannabis has the potential to alleviate a number of symptoms associated with chronic and debilitating conditions. on just a few of the conditions for which medical cannabis may be appropriate, including:
  • Chronic Pain
  • Fibromyalgia
  • Headaches and Migraines
  • Cancer
  • Nausea and Vomiting
  • Irritable Bowel Syndrome
  • Epilepsy
  • Multiple Sclerosis 
  • Crohn’s Disease
  • Post Traumatic Stress Disorder
  • Sleep
  • Arthritis
  • Palliative Care
For more information on the potential conditions for which medical cannabis may be appropriate, please visit the GrowWise Health Benefits of Medical Cannabis page. All referred patients have access to complimentary education services provided by GrowWise Health. The GrowWise Health Patient Educators combine healthcare knowledge and medical cannabis expertise to help:
  • Educate your patient about the therapeutic effects of medical cannabis
  • Provide your patent with essential guidelines for safe and effective use of your medical cannabis
  • Assist your patient in choosing the best strain for their condition and symptoms
  • Assist your patient with registering and placing their order with a Health Canada Licensed Producer
  • Customize their treatment plan to help them achieve their health goals
  • Provide your patient with ongoing support
  • Provide you, the referring physician, with education session summary notes.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Medical Marijuana Referrals for Doctors | White Cedar Cannabis Doctors
White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors is trusted by healthcare practitioners in the Greater Toronto Area and across Ontario. Complete our referral package.

item.title: FAQs
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Frequently Asked Questions about Medical Marijuana If eligible, how do I get medical marijuana? We review your referral package and accompanying medical documentation after you send it in. Patients that are assessed by a physician and deemed eligible for medical cannabis receive a medical document, which can be sent to one of the Health Canada approved Licensed Producers  of medical cannabis. Patients place orders directly with their licensed producer, and all orders are shipped via courier to the patient’s address.   Our partners GrowWise Health can help you choose the Licensed Producer that is right for you. What forms of medical marijuana are available to me? In addition to dried marihuana, Cannabis oil (otherwise known as thc oil or cbd oil) is also available to patients under the ACMPR. You can also make cannabis oil from your dried marijuana. Do I get a medical marijuana card? All orders from Licensed Producers will come in a bottle with an accompanying label. Some LPs do include a client card as a courtesy, although clients should always carry their medical cannabis in a bottle with an accompanying label from the Licensed Producer. What conditions may medical cannabis be appropriate for? Medical cannabis has been shown to be appropriate for a wide range of conditions and symptoms. To see just a few examples, visit GrowWise Health’s Benefits of Medical Cannabis Page. A new dispensary just opened up around the block in Toronto. Should I go there to access my medical cannabis? White Cedar operates within the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations, Canada’s legal medical cannabis system. Medical cannabis under the ACMPR is accurately dosed and stringently tested to ensure it is free of contaminants. The ACMPR is currently the only way for medical cannabis users to obtain a legal supply of medical cannabis. I don’t live in Toronto. Can you help find a medical marijuana doctor near me? Our clinic in Toronto serves patients from the Greater Toronto Area and across Ontario. If you live far away from our clinic, we’re here to help. Fill out the contact form or call us at 416-923-6970. I’m a healthcare practitioner and I want to integrate medical cannabis directly into my practice. Our partner GrowWise Health offers training and education services for physicians. Click here for more information. If you believe cannabis may be right for your patients, please connect with us by completing our referral package.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Frequently Asked Questions | White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors
Frequently Asked Questions about medical cannabis that are asked in Toronto and across Ontario.

item.title: Chronic Pain
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Medical Cannabis for Chronic Pain in Toronto & Across Canada Free Medical Marijuana Clinic • Covered by OHIP White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors are trusted by chronic pain patients and healthcare practitioners in the Greater Toronto Area and across Ontario. Our fully integrated clinic in Toronto offers comprehensive cannabis assessment and education services for eligible patients. Our location serves many patients from communities across the Greater Toronto Area, including Vaughan, Markham, Richmond Hill, Newmarket, Mississauga, and Brampton. GrowWise Health Patient Educators combine healthcare knowledge and cannabis expertise to help chronic pain patients and healthcare providers with medical marijuana education and support services across Toronto, Ontario, and Canada. Chronic pain is defined as lasting more than 12 weeks, and can be initially caused by some injury, although it is not always clear. Concomitant symptoms accompanying pain are often fatigue, sleep disturbance, decreased appetite and mood changes. Chronic pain may also decrease a person’s mobility, strength, flexibility, and stamina. Cannabis may have several potential therapeutic benefits to help manage symptoms of chronic pain. THC, the main psychoactive ingredient of cannabis, has analgesic properties and can provide pain relief. CBD, a cannabinoid known to mitigate the psychoactive effects of THC, is known to be a powerful anti-inflammatory agent. Chronic pain affects approximately one in five people and is expected to increase to one in three people over the next two decades. Patients suffering from chronic pain are often tasked with managing a plethora of physical, psychological and psychosocial factors that accompany their condition. Chronic pain is a commonly occurring symptom of a number of other conditions such as multiple sclerosis, HIV/AIDS, cancer, fibromyalgia, and others. Patients suffering from chronic pain may experience a number of additional frequently occurring symptoms, such as Irritable Bowel Syndrome, headaches, muscle spasms, and disturbances in sleep, among others. The combined effects of THC and CBD may provide a strong platform to help manage the symptoms of chronic pain.[/fusion_text][/one_full][/fullwidth]

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Marijuana for Chronic Pain | White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors
Cannabis may have several potential therapeutic benefits to help manage symptoms of chronic pain. Book a no-fee, OHIP-covered assessment today.

item.title: Fibromyalgia
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Medical Cannabis for Fibromyalgia in Toronto & Across Canada Free Medical Marijuana Clinic • Covered by OHIP White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors is trusted by fibromyalgia patients and healthcare practitioners in the Greater Toronto Area and across Ontario. Our fully integrated clinic in Toronto offers comprehensive cannabis assessment and education services for eligible patients. Our location serves many patients from communities across the Greater Toronto Area, including Vaughan, Markham, Richmond Hill, Newmarket, Mississauga, and Brampton. Symptoms of fibromyalgia (FM) include generalized pain, but often comes with concomitant symptoms such as morning stiffness, tiredness, migraine/headache and sleep disturbances. Cannabis has been shown to provide therapeutic potential because of its abilities to be anti-spastic, and provide some neuropathic pain relief. Patients may also use cannabis to manage concomitant symptoms such as fatigue and sleep disturbances.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Marijauna for Fibromyalgia | White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors
Cannabis has been shown to provide therapeutic potential for Fibromyalgia because of its anti-spastic abilities. Book a free, OHIP-covered assessment today.

item.title: Cancer
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Medical Cannabis for Cancer in Toronto and Across Canada Free Medical Marijuana Clinic • Covered by OHIPWhite Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors is trusted by cancer patients and healthcare practitioners in the Greater Toronto Area and across Ontario. Our fully integrated clinic in Toronto offers comprehensive cannabis assessment and education services for eligible patients, free of charge. Our main location serves many patients from communities across the Greater Toronto Area, including Vaughan, Markham, Richmond Hill, Newmarket, Mississauga, and Brampton. Symptoms of cancer are wide-spread, and is dependent on the cancer that the patient wishes to treat. Research indicates that up to 95% of cancer patients suffer from uncontrolled pain related to their cancer. Cannabis has proven anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects which can help decrease the experience of pain during this difficult time. In addition, chemotherapy, a common treatment for cancer, is known to cause nausea and vomiting. Cancer treatments may also cause a general decrease in well-being for the patient as a result of the nature of the cancer fighting medication. Medical cannabis can be instrumental in not just treating the pain caused by the cancer, but also in mitigating the symptoms caused by cancer treatments. Cannabis is a known antiemetic, meaning that it has the ability to help nausea and vomiting that is associated with chemotherapy. In addition to helping relieve nausea, it has also been shown to be an appetite stimulant. It can further help cancer patients normalize their daily routines by helping with anxiety, sleep patterns, and depression.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Marijuana for Cancer | White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors
Medical Cannabis can be instrumental in not just treating the pain caused by the cancer, but also in mitigating the symptoms caused by cancer treatments.

item.title: Headaches/Migraines
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Medical Cannabis for Headaches and Migraines in Toronto & Across Canada Free Medical Marijuana Clinic • Covered by OHIP White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors are a medical marijuana clinic trusted by migraine & headache patients and healthcare practitioners in the Greater Toronto Area and across Ontario. Our fully integrated clinic in Toronto offers comprehensive cannabis assessment and education services for eligible patients. Our location serves many patients from communities across the Greater Toronto Area, including Vaughan, Markham, Richmond Hill, Newmarket, Mississauga, and Brampton. Recent studies have shown that cannabis can be helpful in treating headaches and migraines, supporting the further investigation of marijuana for migraines. The study, by Rhyne et al. 2016, found that amongst 121 adult participants, the frequency of headaches reduced from 10.4 per month to 4.6. The reason for this still remains unclear. It has been argued that some individuals may have a clinical endocannabinoid deficiency, or that CB2 receptors may play a critical role. Further research has to be done, however, it has become evident that cannabis may provide a therapeutic platform for headaches and migraines.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Recent studies have shown that cannabis can be helpful in treating headaches and migraines. Book a free OHIP-covered medical assessment in our clinic today.

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: Vanessa
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: Vanessa
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Irritable Bowel Syndrome
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Medical Cannabis for Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) in Toronto and Across Canada Free Medical Marijuana Clinic • Covered by OHIP White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors are trusted by Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) patients and healthcare practitioners in the Greater Toronto Area and across Ontario. Our fully integrated clinic in Toronto offers comprehensive cannabis assessment and education services for eligible patients, free of charge. Our location serves patients from communities across the Greater Toronto Area, including Vaughan, Markham, Richmond Hill, Newmarket, Mississauga, and Brampton. Symptoms of IBS are numerous, such as pain in the abdomen and irregular bowel movements. Many patients may also suffer from nausea. These symptoms can be difficult to manage and traditional treatment options are often found to be ineffective. However, recent research studies have shown that cannabis may be helpful in relieving and managing IBS and helping patients improve their quality of life. The therapeutic effects of cannabis have been attributed to the presence of CB2 receptors in the Gastro-intestinal tract. These receptors are activated by cannabidiol, also known as CBD, a non-psychoactive cannabinoid in the cannabis plant. The results of CBD rich cannabis strains are anti-inflammatory effects as well as a decrease in abdominal pain. Research indicates that cannabis has also been found to help in the movement of secretions as well as regulation of bowel movements. Because cannabinoids such as CBD act on CB1 and CB2 receptors found throughout our body's and throughout our endocannabinoid system, cannabis has the potential to assist with a variety of related symptoms. In addition to relieving inflammation and managing pain, cannabis has the potential to decrease anxiety and improve the quality and duration of sleep.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Marijuana for IBS | White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors
Recent studies have shown that cannabis may be helpful in relieving and managing IBS. Book a no-fee, OHIP-covered medical assessment in our clinic today.

item.title: Epilepsy
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Medical Cannabis for Epilepsy in Toronto & Across Ontario Free Medical Marijuana Clinic • Covered by OHIP White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors are trusted by epilepsy patients and healthcare practitioners in the Greater Toronto Area and across Ontario. Our fully integrated clinic in Toronto offers comprehensive cannabis assessment and education services for eligible patients. Our location serves many patients from communities across the Greater Toronto Area, including Vaughan, Markham, Richmond Hill, Newmarket, Mississauga, and Brampton. Seizures are the primary symptom concern associated with epilepsy. Although there are twenty different anti-seizure medications, 30% of patients continue to have seizures. Cannabis has been shown to help manage seizures by stimulating CB1 and CB2 receptors. CBD has been shown to be an anti-convulsant and has been suggested as a medication to treat epilepsy. However, the exact mechanism as to how it works is unknown.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Cannabis for Epilepsy | White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors
CBD has been shown to be an anti-convulsant, and has been suggested as a medication to treat epilepsy. Book a free, OHIP-covered assessment today.

item.title: Multiple Sclerosis
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Medical Cannabis for Multiple Sclerosis in Toronto & Across CanadaFree Medical Marijuana Clinic • Covered by OHIP White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors are trusted by multiple sclerosis patients and healthcare practitioners in the Greater Toronto Area and across Ontario. Our fully integrated clinic in Toronto offers comprehensive cannabis assessment and education services for eligible patients. Our location serves many patients from communities across the Greater Toronto Area, including Vaughan, Markham, Richmond Hill, Newmarket, Mississauga, and Brampton. The symptoms of Multiple Sclerosis (MS) are extensive, due to its neurodegenerative basis. Individuals may develop blurry vision, trouble thinking, speech and sexual difficulties. Muscle spasms, trouble walking, pain, numbness and tingling, mobility problems, and bladder problems. Mental health difficulties may also be present such as depression and anxiety. Cannabis has been shown to effectively help mitigate symptoms caused by MS. It has been shown to help alleviate muscle spasticity, and generally, help with neurologically-based pain amongst these patients.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Cannabis for Multiple Sclerosis | White Cedar Medical Cannabis Doctors
Medical marijuana has been shown to effectively help mitigate symptoms caused by MS. White Cedar is a free medical cannabis clinic.
